Title: Series: The Prudhoe Lions
Description: Red granite statue of recumbent lion: the inscriptions are incised on the breast of the lion, and on the upper surface, sides and ends of the pedestal. It is a dedicatory text of Tutankhamun on pedestal. The text names Amanislo on the chest.
Bibliographic references: Edwards 1939 / Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae e.t.c. in the British Museum (pp. 13-14, pl. 14)

Wilson 1989 / The Collections of the British Museum (pp. 62, 64)
Quirke 1990 / Who were the Pharaohs? A History of their Names with a List of Cartouches (p. 78)
Reeves 1990 / The Complete Tutankhamun: The King, the Tomb, the Treasure (p. 29)
Davies 1991 / Egypt and Africa: Nubia from Prehistory to Islam (p. 314)
Winstone 1991 / Howard Carter and the Discovery of the Tomb of Tutankhamun (p. 257)
